text: Nokia E7 is a mobile phone model made by Nokia. It complements Nokia's higher- end N8, which does not have a QWERTY keyboard. == Hardware == The phone has a 4-inch (diagonally measured) AMOLED screen. The phone can connect to the internet using its built-in 3G, EDGE or WiFi radios. It can connect to other devices, such as computers or other phones with its Bluetooth radio. The phone also contains a GPS receiver, which uses Nokia's Ovi maps software for street directions. The service is free for the E7 owners. Maps can be obtained through Nokia's Ovi market. The phone has a non-autofocus camera that can take 8 megapixel photos or video in up to 720p at 25 fps. The phone has no place for a memory card. == Software == The phone is pre-loaded with an email client, a calendar, an office suite with support for Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint, a PDF viewer and other common productivity applications. The E7 uses the Symbian^3 operating system. Equipment Data and Internet GPS, Wi-FI, 3G, GPRS/EDGE, HSDPA, Bluetooth, HSUPA, Inserted modem, WAP Operation system Symbian^3 Fun MP3 player, FM radio, jack 3.5mm, Java, Games Camera and video VGA camera, video recording, flash, 8Mpx camera Calling and messages SMS, MMS, T9, handsfree, vibrate calling, conference talk Internet and email web browser, email client Office function calendar, alarm clock, stop watch, calculator, notes, voice recorder == References == * Category:Nokia mobile phones
title: Nokia E7
